newsitem.title: USA: BOXING-LEWIS IS CONFIDENT AGAINST MCCALL.
newsitem.headline: BOXING-LEWIS IS CONFIDENT AGAINST MCCALL.

text.p: Oliver McCall knocked him down once, but it won't happen when they meet again next month for the vacant World Boxing Council (WBC) heavyweight championship promised Lennox Lewis.

"Oliver McCall had his eyes closed when he threw that punch," Lewis said of the hammering right hand that sent him to the canvas in the second round of his title defence against the American in London on Sept. 24, 1995.
It appeared, however, that McCall deftly ducked beneath Lewis' defence and landed a classic right to drop Lewis.
Lewis staggered to his feet clearly hurt, and referee Lupe Garcia stopped the bout, handing the Briton his only defeat in 30 professional fights.
McCall, 28-6, subsquently lost the belt to Lewis' countryman Frank Bruno, who then surrendered the title with little opposition to Mike Tyson last March.

When Tyson choose to relinquish the WBC crown to fight Evander Holyfield instead of the mandatory challenger Lewis, who took "step-aside money," it set up the February 7 rematch at the Las Vegas Hilton.

"You only get lucky once in a lifetime and for that to happen again is virtually impossible," Lewis said, of his first fight with McCall, in a tele-conference Tuesday from his training camp in Scottsdale, Arizona.
McCall has had a rocky road leading up to the fight.
He was arrested last month on a variety of charges after throwing a Christmas tree in a hotel lobby, and recently entered a third drug rehabilitation programme.
"I'm not interested in that," Lewis said of McCall's troubles. "That's not my concern. I'm more concerned that when he steps up in the ring he will be up against a man looking to beat him.
"I'm not taking him lightly and am looking forward to meeting him in the ring again," Lewis said.
Lewis last fought seven months ago when he held on to beat Ray Mercer by decision.
"The waiting is what I can't take," Lewis said of his long layoff. "I wish the fight was yesterday."
